data.title: Apple turns to Trump for help getting around tariffs

data.text: The iPhone 11 might be caught in the crossfire.

data.title: Inside the department at Apple that greenlights iPhone apps for the App Store
data.text: An executive board led by Apple marketing SVP Phil Schiller meets every week to discuss controversial apps or other iPhone software programs that may infringe Apple's App Store guidelines.

data.title: Friday Apple Rumors: Apple May Use OLED Screens in MacBook and iPad
data.text:
Friday's Apple Rumors include Qualcomm bringing Apple into its FTC lawsuit, Foxconn's founder asking AAPL to leave China and more.

data.title: Apple Warns More Tariffs on Chinese Goods Will Hurt U.S. Economy
data.text: Linda Bakhshian, Federated Investors senior portfolio manager, talks about the trade war impact on Apple and its supply chains. She appears on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

data.title: Foxconn founder wants Apple to move plants from China to Taiwan     - CNET
data.text: There may be other reasons why he's urging Apple to make iPhones elsewhere.

data.text: Goldman says Spotify, Vivendi, Sony and Tencent will thrive as the market moves to paid services.

data.title: Apple: While Consumers Aren't Upgrading As Often, They Are Still Being Monetized
data.text: While iPhone units have not continued their torrid growth rate, the installed base continues to grow.

data.title: Can Trump's Trade War With China Boost Apple's iPhone Sales?
data.text: The iPhone maker's declining fortunes could get a shot in the arm thanks to the U.S.-China trade war.
